page.title: 10Litter and Pollution
page.content: LITTER In the 4 square km. area we surveyed we found a lot of litter, particularly near fences and hedges where the wind had blown it. Much was packaging which had been carelessly discarded, paper, cardboard, glass, and metal were all in evidence. Willenhall Precinct was littered with rubbish, dicarded food, and dog excrement. There were several concrete litter containers around but little use had been made of them. The walls of the buildings in this area were also covered with graffitti. POLLUTION The River Sowe at Stoke Floods contained eight supermarket trolleys, a bread basket,a crate,a pram wheel as well as an assortment of other metal. No pollution by oil, detergents or other chemicals was found.
